Articles.Content:
here's a ss of the part of the ship where I have a problem.
when I'm aerobraking on eve the mining excavator burns almost instantly.

near the drillomatic there are others stuffs, the TCS and the solar array that do not suffer with the heat.
why only the excavator explodes? and why as it is covered by a big shield?

https://www.dropbox.com/s/lhgb9bocqsgj4w6/shield.jpg?dl=0

I've just tried it with a rough copy of your craft and I don't get that problem. 

You are managing to keep the craft retrograde OK?

You could just try detaching and re-attaching the drill to another part and moving it back to position. 

(Though I'm not sure what you have going on with those extra stacks attached to the side of the craft). 

Edited April 1, 2017 by Foxster

I tried to delete and reinstall a new drillomatic but its the same, it explodes behind the shield.
here's my ship.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/hk6ds2sgiu1lr0m/antipro eve manned prototype 42.craft?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/t4blp5hnfceqw82/AAC_hXpGfxQKcEEDrCvNEesca?dl=0
That's a pretty big craft you are trying to get down. What's it all for?

I know its big and probably not optimized very well, but it works somehow.
purpose land on eve and back to kerbin.

please help me to understand why those pieces burn so fast.

Edited April 1, 2017 by antipro

I experienced this problems with drills too. Thus was mostly because off the drills looked like they are behind the Schild but where clipping Inside. There are some modes that Show you the mesh of parts but for me it was to complex . Than i tried a workaround with attaching the drills higher and adjust the drill one step higher and heatshild one step lower with the gismo. This works mostly good for me. Maybe it will help you too.

Funny Kabooms

Urses

what's gismo?
"An unspecified or unspecifiable object"?
http://www.dictionary.com/browse/gismo

If I've understood well, you're talking about something like this image:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/bwqpt76hr22veya/Screenshot 2017-04-01 13.32.44.png?dl=0

ok this have some sense, it's a kind of bug.
uhm... well, I'gonna try to find a workaround me too...

 

Edited April 1, 2017 by antipro

3 minutes ago, antipro said:

what's gismo?
"An unspecified or unspecifiable object"?
http://www.dictionary.com/browse/gismo

If I've understood well, you're talking about something like this image:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/bwqpt76hr22veya/Screenshot 2017-04-01 13.32.44.png?dl=0

ok this have some sense, it's a kind of bug.
uhm... well, I'gonna try to find a workaround me too...

 

The Second One 

A littel helping tool is a gismo too.

I moved the drill back in a way that is covered even if extended and now it no longer burns.
will this issue be corrected in next version?

thx.

Edited April 1, 2017 by antipro

1 hour ago, Urses said:

Thus was mostly because off the drills looked like they are behind the Schild but where clipping Inside.

Similar issues with cargo bays. If you've got drills too close to the edges of the bay, it'll count them as unshielded (generating massive drag) even though they appear to be entirely inside.

I suspect that the collision mesh is slightly misaligned on both sizes of drill.

34 minutes ago, Wanderfound said:

I suspect that the collision mesh is slightly misaligned on both sizes of drill.

Or maybe through animation and Computer did not everytime count if it is in work or transport modus. I use the chain place->deploy->retract->ofset up->Save. After this ot looks to be counted as schilded.

With cargobays i has One time the behavor where i was forced to close the cargobay for unstoved.
